MEET THE GRAND OAKS TEAM TOM GOLISANO Owner In March of 2011, a new plan for development of an equine destination resort in central Florida was launched with Tom Golisano’s purchase of the Florida Carriage Museum. Since that time, the lush museum property has evolved The Grand Oaks Resort of today with a variety of new features including our RV Park, covered arena, and new guest accommodations and amenities. Tom Golisano is a noted American entrepreneur and philanthropist. Golisano is the Founder and Chairman of the Board of Paychex, Inc., the second largest payroll processing company in the U.S., and he served as its President and Chief Executive Officer until 2004. He founded the B. Thomas Golisano Foundation in 1985 to provide and improve services for individuals with developmental disabilities, and he and is the Special Olympics’ largest individual contributor. Golisano has often been recognized for his entrepreneurial, civic, and philanthropic achievements and endeavors. Paychex is a Fortune 1000 company, and Golisano was listed among Forbes’ Top 10 Bosses in the U.S. for three consecutive years, beginning in 2002. KACY TIPTON-FASHIK General Manager Grand Oaks Resort & Saddle Club has promoted Kacy Tipton-Fashik to General Manager. Kacy Tipton-Fashik previously served as the resort’s Equine Manager and Assistant Manager, under Thomas Warriner. Warriner had been instrumental in marketing both resort and competition based equine ventures throughout the US, South and Central America and the Pacific basin. In her new role, she is responsible for leading the resort staff, orchestrating major events, overseeing the guest experience, and managing all day-to-day business at Grand Oaks. “I am delighted to continue to grow in my career here at Grand Oaks,” Tipton-Fashik said. “Our combination of natural beauty, guest amenities, and signature equestrian facilities and events makes this a resort unlike any other.” Tipton-Fashik brings extensive experience at the resort to her new role as General Manager. She first started at the property in November 1999, when it was still known as the Florida Carriage Museum. Over the years, she has helped grow Grand Oaks into the unique destination for equestrians, leisure travelers, and sporting enthusiasts that it is today. With a lifetime of riding and equestrian sports enthusiasm, and more than a decade of business management experience, Tipton-Fashik is well suited to lead Grand Oaks into the future. She also enjoys the variety of activities at Grand Oaks and the laid-back family resort atmosphere. 352.750.5500 • Ext. 229 E-MAIL KACY PLEASE NOTE : All guests and competitors must view and sign our liability release online. Grand Oaks RV Resort Toggle navigation Find a Campsite Campground Directory About Contact Join Login français Canada Grand Oaks RV Resort Grand Oaks RV Resort Introduction Amenities Facilities Nearby Directions Contact 107 Haldimand Hwy 54 Cayuga, ON N0A 1E0 Private Campground The Grand Oaks Resort and Museum is proud to introduce its newest accommodations – THE GRAND OAKS RV. Our newest resort addition serves our 400 acre resort community in two ways; as an event venue offering active and passive participation in live equine events, competitions and education AND unique motor coach facility for travelers who want to enjoy the beauty of our resort and its close proximity to the famed “Villages” retirement community. Our newest facility was uniquely designed in keeping with the character and mission of being one of American’s finest equestrian resorts. Additionally, our RV guest have access to 400 acres of trails, groomed outdoor space, fishing, as well as the Grand Oaks Arena, a speculator 51,000 square foot covered arena. Each visit offers an unequaled experience to explore one of the nation’s most respected museums; an educational experience that includes over 165 fully restored American and European carriages and driving accessories. All sites were built with the needs and desires of large-rig guests. We offer pull-thrus and back-ins with 35+’ wide sites and 65’ and 85’ lengths, full hook-ups, paved roads, concrete pads and patios, as well as Wi-Fi. Our park was designed for large coaches without ever unhooking. For our equine guests we offer a few grass sites with all the other amenities, plus stalls and paddocks are available for their traveling companions. In addition to our “Bistro and Bar” next to our museum, our guest can enjoy their own Clubhouse, 3 private bathrooms with showers, a laundry room, a gathering room with a 60’ TV and pool table, and one unique new concept – 1 private 2 room suite and two private hotel rooms which are available to equine and RV guests who desire additional accommodations for their traveling guests – “extra beds for extra heads”. Lastly, our sites are all terraced sties with beautiful views. We are definitely one unique RV resort. GOOGLE MAP SHOWS THE WRONG PROPERTY WILL CORRECT WHEN GOOGLE FIXES. Joyce and her Staff in Reservations and Management were Wonderful Hosts in setting up our Reservation from 11-01-2024 through 12-15-2024 and Comforting Settling us in. Stacey and her Husband were Great Camp Hosts visiting our Site with a Wealth of Information and Answering our Questions. This is a Beautiful RV Park setting on a Horse Ranch of 400 Acres with Beautiful Drives through the Ranch.  There are Pull Through and Back in Sites with Full Hook Ups, on Level Concrete Pads and the Sites are Very Spacious.  We had Great Internet, TV, and Phone Service here. Very Clean and Well Maintained it is Luxurious with a Nice Club House, Pool, and Laundry Facilities. It is so Quiet and Peaceful here, yet drive 15 Minutes and 10 Miles or so and You are in the Heart of the Villages, with all the Recreation and Amenities, Restaurants, Grocery Stores, Retail Stores etc.  The RV Resort has its own Restaurant, the Bistro with Great Food, and Megan, Susie, Jerika, and Debbie will make You feel at home. We took in Three Different Equestrian Horse Shows on Three Different Weekends in the RV Park, English Dressage, Show Jumping and Wagon Racing, and on another Weekend a Dog Agility Show !  There are many State Parks in the Area, we took two Boat Tours and saw Manatees and Alligators and all kinds of Birds and Wildlife.  Beaches on the Atlantic Coast and the Gulf Coast are only a little over an hour away. We are coming back 12-15-2025 through 01-30-2026. Look no further than The Grand Oaks Resort in Weirsdale, Florida. Nestled amidst stunning landscapes and equipped with top-notch facilities, The Grand Oaks Resort provides an ideal setting for your corporate retreat. You should choose The Grand Oaks Resort for your next company getaway. Scenic Beauty and Tranquility Imagine your team stepping into a serene oasis, surrounded by lush greenery and majestic oak trees. The Grand Oaks Resort offers a picturesque environment that instantly calms the mind and inspires creativity. The natural beauty of our resort creates the perfect backdrop for productive meetings and team-building activities, far away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Versatile Event Spaces Whether you’re planning a small team meeting or a large corporate event, The Grand Oaks Resort has versatile event spaces to accommodate your needs. Our banquet halls and meeting rooms are equipped with Audio/Visual equipment and can be customized to suit your requirements. From formal presentations to casual brainstorming sessions, we have the perfect space for every occasion. Comfortable Accommodations At The Grand Oaks Resort, we understand the importance of comfort during your stay. Our beautifully appointed villas and homes offer luxurious accommodations for your team. Each space is designed with relaxation in mind, featuring modern amenities and cozy furnishings. After a day of meetings and activities, your team can unwind in style and comfort. Exceptional Dining Options Food is an essential part of any retreat, and The Grand Oaks Resort doesn’t disappoint. Our on-site dining, The Bistro, provides a range of delicious and healthy meals. In The Oak Room, breakfast, lunch, and dinner can be arranged and served buffet or grab and go . Team-Building Activities A company retreat is the perfect opportunity to strengthen team bonds and boost morale. The Grand Oaks Resort offers a variety of team-building activities that are both fun and engaging. Whether it’s a friendly game of golf, a relaxing yoga session, or a thrilling equestrian experience, we have something for everyone. Our experienced staff can help you plan activities that align with your team’s interests and goals. Accessibility and Convenience Located in Weirsdale, Florida, The Grand Oaks Resort is easily accessible from major cities and airports. This convenience makes it an ideal choice for companies with team members traveling from different locations. Customized Retreat Packages We understand that every company has unique needs and objectives for their retreat. That’s why The Grand Oaks Resort offers customized retreat packages tailored to your specific requirements. Our dedicated event planners work closely with you to create a retreat that meets your goals and exceeds your expectations. From personalized itineraries to special requests, we are committed to making your retreat a success . Inspiring Surroundings for Creativity and Innovation The tranquil environment and natural beauty of The Grand Oaks Resort provide the perfect setting for creative thinking and innovation. Away from the distractions of the office, your team can focus on brainstorming new ideas and developing strategies for future success. The peaceful surroundings inspire fresh perspectives and foster a collaborative atmosphere. Conclusion Choosing the right location for your company’s retreat is crucial for its success. The Grand Oaks Resort offers everything you need for a memorable and productive retreat. From stunning landscapes and comfortable accommodations to versatile event spaces and exciting activities, our resort is designed to meet all your needs. So why wait? Book your company’s retreat at The Grand Oaks Resort today and give your team the experience they deserve .
